result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 12 months upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler J Adams

records.addlTxt: of conviction.  Court extends defendants probation until 10/18/19 in order to complete AODA and Domestic Violence treatment.  Supervision can discharge during this time once treatment has been completed.
from DOC agent Tim Greil with request to extend defendants probation.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court extends defendants supervision for one year from 10/18/17 to 10/18/18 in order to complete AODA treatment and ATV: supervision can discharge during this time once treatment has been completed.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Tyler J Adams
Current: P.O. Box 164, Sister Bay, WI 54234 United States  (Effective: 04-20-2016)
Prior: 2397 Maple Dr Apt 2, Sister Bay, WI 54234

Defendant Tyler J Adams in court with attorney Nathan John Dineen.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Plea hearing on April 18, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Tyler J Adams in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Dineens office called this morning and he's not able to make it to court because of a family emergency. Court reschedules. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. No violent contact with H.M.

Defendant Tyler J Adams in court with attorney Nathan John Dineen.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:45 am.
